results.title: Aussie assault
results.creator_credit: Harvey Spencer, Bill Scholer, Garry Holt and Sportmaster Programs
results.brief_description: A behind-the-scenes look at the work and preparation that went into Australia II winning entry in the America’s Cup. Shows the crew at leisure as well as at work.

results.title: Seeds of change
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Examines changes in Victorian farm life documenting its evolution from horse to tractor to modern machinery. Filmed on location at Jeparit, this program uses period re-creation and documentary footage.

results.title: Not only to save our jobs
results.brief_description: Shows how a group of people at a small Melbourne manufacturing company acted to overcome the threat of losing their jobs by setting up a new form of organisation based on worker participation in ownership and decision-making. The effects on employees’ attitudes and work relationships are shown.

results.title: You Can Do It Too!
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: A character called “x”, who is neither male nor female, points out all the opportunities available to people when gender is made irrelevant. Shows how role stereotyping begins at birth and carries through into school and work. Shows men and women working and finding fulfilment in non-traditional areas. The band playing towards the end of the film features the now ABC political journalist, Fran Kelly, in an unfamiliar guise.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Diane O’Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Just a story
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor, Tony Paice, Barbara Boyd-Anderson and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: An attempt to show that storytelling is not just part of literature but is part of the everyday world around us and the ways in which we relate to each other. Demonstrates that our own experiences provide a rich source of information which may be drawn upon for the writing of stories.

results.title: Energy Conservation in the Home
results.creator_credit: Dept of Minerals and Energy AV Workshop
results.brief_description:
“Energy conservation in the home” provides useful information on the ways in which energy can be saved within the household.

See also Related Title 325491 “Victoria’s energy”; uses stills to analyse Victoria’s energy position during 1980-81.

results.title: [The Tatler social newsreel]
results.brief_description: This film was one of the many documentaries shot in Victoria by Efftee Studios in the early 30s. In this newsreel compiled and narrated by Peter Newmarch of “The Truth” newspaper and shot by Bert Nicholas, several Melbourne socialites are featured at various functions: a social party in South Yarra, the first official meeting of the Centenary Dog Club at the Melbourne Showground and Ron Cameron’s Riding School. NOTE: No titles included.

results.title: The Age of change
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Looks at the impact of technological change on the Melbourne newspaper ‘The Age’ and considers this change in terms of its effect on the people involved. Highlights the increasing competition at the desk of reporters and editors from electronic information systems, and the impact of technology on the once labour-intensive area of printing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Factory to farm
results.brief_description: Shows the various stages in the manufacture of farm implements and machinery and their use on Australian wheat farms during the 1920s. An important film on Australian history, both from farming and the “Sunshine Harvester Factory” points of view. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
